trial_identification.studytitle: Protocol to collect the late latency auditory evoked potentials in ten adults with normal hearing
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A comparison of the Subtraction of the Ocular´s Artifact and the Control of the Rejection´s Limit protocols, in the record of the late latency auditory evoked potentials in ten adults with normal hearing

conditions.healthcondition: protocol to collect the late latency auditory evoked potentials

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Studies of the normal brain and nervous system

interventions.interventions: Comparison of two diagnostic´s protocols (subtraction of the ocular´s artifact and control of the rejection´s limit) to collect the late latency auditory evoked potentials. Both protocols are the intervention, which were compared for the selection of the greatest adequate to collect the late latency auditory evoked potentials. Prospective study by the aplication of these two methods in ten normally hearing adults, by the utilization of the equipment with two record´s channels, and controlling the artifact produced by the ocular´s movement. The subtraction of the ocular´s artifact protocol consist in the subtraction of the ocular´s movement registered in the captivating of the late latency auditory evoked potentials. Unfavourable, the control of the rejection´s limit protocol consist in the no captivating of the ocular´s movement while the record of the late latency auditory evoked potentials. The application of these protocols in the participants remained two months and both protocols were applied only one session in each participant, one followed another, in the same session. The application of each protocol remain about ten minutes.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The two methods were eficcient to control of the ocular movement's artifact while the collection of the late latency auditory evoked potentials. This is observed after the analysis of the latency and amplitude's values of the late latency auditory evoked potentials and the application of the paired test t statistical's method.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Two months after the start of the study. Throughout the application of the two protocols and after the end of the whole sessions. Treatment wasn't used. Diagnostic's protocol was used.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Higher amplitude's values were observed in the method of the control of the rejection's limit. This is checked by the analysis of the amplitude's values and the application of the paired test t statistical's method.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Two months after the start of the study. Throughout the application of the two protocols and after the end of the whole sessions. Treatment wasn't used. Diagnostic's protocol was used.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Normal hearing and absence of neurologic´s complaints.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Deafness hearing and presence of neurologic´s complaints.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To compare two methods to collect the late latency auditory evoked potentials, by the utilization of equipment with two record´s channels and controlling the artifact produced by the ocular's movement.
